resources.string: View other PuZZleDucK Industries apps in the Play Store.
Join dropbox and refer PuZZleDucK Industries.

Thanks for trying Euler 02. This is my programmatic solution to challenge 2 of Project Euler.

The problem description is as follows:
 By considering the terms in the Fibonacci sequence whose values do not exceed four million, find the sum of the even-valued terms.

 My solution allows a user to select even or odd and sum the numbers in the Fibonacci sequence from 1 to the selected count. This values are displayed with uncounted Fibonacci numbers in red and the total sum at the bottom right.

 It is interesting to note the odd-odd-even sequence of the Fibonacci numbers explaned by the cyclic adding of pairs of odd-odd to produce even, then even-odd to produce an odd, then odd-even to produce andother odd and then odd-odd to start the cycle again.

Icon image is derrived from the work of Leslie Chatfield c/o Fotopedia… link above.

I hope you enjoy, I'm looking forward to creating more.

Thanks for trying Euler 02.

Please support further developent by following the links below to rate and review my apps in the Play Store (or in your own Blog :D) or you can support development directly by contribuiting code or commentary to the project on GitHub directly.

This project is 100% open source and gpl.

In any case thanks for supporting PuZZleDucK Industries by installing Euler 01 [Hello Euler] in the first place.

You can also help support development by helping me up my Dropbox capacity by using me as a reference ;) it's quick, painless and best of all FREE :D what are you waiting for!
